channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What We Know About the Dallas ICE Facility Shooting and Suspect
item.description: One detainee was killed and two others were wounded after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The gunman died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.title: Meet Lindsey Halligan, the 36-year-old former Miss Colorado hopeful who only worked 3 federal cases before Trump promoted her to U.S. attorney
item.description: Halligan, who competed in the Miss Colorado USA pageant twice, will now lead one of the nation's most important federal prosecutor offices.

item.title: Gen Z is reviving this boring job that millennials and boomers abandoned—and it’s helping them land six-figure careers straight out of college
item.description: About 75% of accountants are expected to retire in the next decade, and some Gen Zers are realizing that the field is not so boring after all—especial...

item.title: Gen Zers are dating people 25% better than they are. They’re calling it ‘throning’—and experts say it’s a quick ticket to long-term success
item.description: Dating experts say “throning” works—it just depends on how your treat your ex and your newfound network.

item.title: What Declines in Reading and Math Mean for the U.S. Work Force
item.description: U.S. employers and colleges are contending with more young people who are behind academically. Some are trying to make up where schools have failed.

item.title: Apple is delaying its live translation for Europeans because of their pesky red tape
item.description: Apple was already fined after the Digital Markets Act took effect last year.

item.title: Trump Assures Arab Leaders He Won’t Allow Israel to Annex West Bank, Officials Say
item.description: After more countries recognized a Palestinian state, President Trump told Mideast and Muslim powers that he would not permit Israel to annex the terri...

item.title: Top Economic Leaders Warn Supreme Court to Allow Lisa Cook to Remain at Fed, for Now
item.description: In a brief filed with the court, former Fed chairs and U.S. Treasury secretaries cautioned of erosion in public confidence in the Fed’s independence.

item.title: Stablecoins are everywhere, but one expert argues that the ultimate winner might not even exist yet
item.description: In the latest episode of the Crypto Playbook, professor and former Paxos executive Austin Campbell argues why stablecoins are poised to break out of c...

item.title: General Assembly Updates: ‘Palestine Is Ours,’ Abbas Tells U.N. by Video
item.description: Mahmoud Abbas, the Palestinian Authority president, vowed that his people “will not leave our land.” His address came days after 10 Western countries ...

item.title: Denmark Briefly Closes More Airports After Unexplained Drone Sightings
item.description: European governments are on alert after Russian incursions into NATO airspace, but the Danish authorities said they could not say who was behind the l...

item.title: Israel Attacks Houthi Targets in Yemeni Capital
item.description: The airstrikes came a day after the Houthi militia launched a drone at the Israeli city of Eilat, wounding 20 people.

item.title: ‘One Battle After Another’ Review: Paul Thomas Anderson’s Rallying Cry
item.description: The director, at the height of his powers, delivers a startling, present-day American epic, with Leonardo DiCaprio as a washed-up radical and doting d...

item.title: Maps: Multiple Earthquakes Strike Venezuela
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
